taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;subfamily amygdaloideae;tribe spiraeeae;genus holodiscus;species microphyllus;variety microphyllus

bio:treatment.description: Short-shoot leaf surfaces sessile- and/or stipitate-glandular, abaxial gray to off-white, veins, intercostal regions, and margins frequently obscured by hairs, tomentose to villous, often with white to gray granular deposits, adaxial puberulent, short-hirsute, velutinous to villous, sometimes hairs very short and surface appearing green to gray-green. Inflorescences 2–9 × 1–7 cm. Pedicels 2–3 mm. Flowers: nectar disc slightly pilose to puberulent, sometimes glabrous; sepals densely pilose to tomentose, usually eglandular; petal base abaxially with few, scattered long hairs.
Rock outcrops, rocky sites in sagebrush and bitterbrush shrublands, edges of talus slopes;
Ariz., Calif., Colo., Idaho, Nev., Oreg., Utah, Wyo.; Mexico (Baja California).
bio:treatment.discussion: Variety microphyllus has the widest range of the varieties. Individual populations are generally small and isolated.
